title: Opinion Reader US Free
creator: F. Baran Elis - Vahit E. Bilgenoglu

extendedInfo.description: Reach opinion columns of top U.S. newspapers instantly! By using this application, you can easily reach opinions, columnistsâ latest columns, letters, op-eds and editorials from the corresponding newspaper's website.When you run the application, newspapers will be listed on the main screen. You can choose one among many newspapers by pressing on it; opinions of that newspaper will be shown along with their writer's names (if any), photographs (if any) and the headlines of columns.  You will be directed to the column in the newspaperâs website after you pressed on the title. Currently Wall Street Journal, USA Today, The New York Times, Los Angeles Times, MercuryNews.com (San Jose Mercury News), The Washington Post, New York Daily News, New York Post, Chicago Tribune, Chicago Sun Times, DallasNews.com (The Dallas Morning News), Houston Chronicle, philly.com (The Philadelphia Inquirer and The Philadelphia Daily News), The Arizona Republic, denverpost.com (The Denver Post), Newsday, Star Tribune, St. Petersburg Times, The Oregonian and The Plain Dealernewspapersâ opinion sections are reachable. You can search the newspaper that you want to read by pressing magnifier button on your phone or tablet.  If you want to share one of the columns with others, while you are on columns list page, press and hold on the listed column and press on âShareâ option to spread the word in various social networking or e-mail applications like Facebook, Twitter, Google+, LinkedIn, Gmail, Yahoo etc.  You can share them when you are on the column page as well by pressing menu and then share button.Please watch the tutorial video to see the utilization of the application.We inserted some ads in the free to use application. Although they are not really disturbing, you can enjoy an ad-free version by purchasing Opinion Reader US Pro or you can check the advertising offers in the free version to support the developers.Please send us an e-mail if you have any requests or complaints.Keywords: opinion, opinions, column, columns, columnist, columnists, op-ed, editorial, editorials, letters, News, newspaper, newspapers, latest news, breaking news, hot news, Wall Street Journal, USA Today, The New York Times, Los Angeles Times, MercuryNews.com (San Jose Mercury News), The Washington Post, New York Daily News, New York Post, Chicago Tribune, Chicago Sun Times, DallasNews.com (The Dallas Morning News), Houston Chronicle, philly.com (The Philadelphia Inquirer and The Philadelphia Daily News), The Arizona Republic,denverpost.com (The Denver Post), Newsday, Star Tribune, St. Petersburg Times, The Oregonian and The Plain Dealer, CNN, L. Gordon Crovitz, Daniel Henninger, Holman W. Jenkins, Jr., William McGurn, Peggy Noonan, Mary Anastasia O'Grady, Joseph Rago, Bret Stephens, Kimberley A. Strasse, Michael Medved, Al Neuharth, Andrew George, Rich Benjamin, Paul Krugman, ROSS DOUTHAT, NICHOLAS D. KRISTOF, THOMAS L. FRIEDMAN, CHARLES M. BLOW, JOE NOCERA, GAIL COLLINS, DAVID BROOKS, Sandy Banks, Steve Lopez, James Rainey, George Skelton, Hector Tobar, Michael Hiltzik, David Lazarus, Tom Petruno, Liz Weston, Meghan Daum, Jonah Goldberg, Doyle McManus, Patt Morrison, Jim Newton, Gregory Rodriguez.
